page.title: 19TRADE IN STANHOE
page.content: Several businesses are based in Stanhoe apart from the basic one of agriculture. 'The Granary', a haulage firm of long-standing which is now coupled with a garden centre, supplies animal feed and is involved in carrying vegetables for local producers to distant markets. The only other public trading is from the village Post Office and General Stores. Goods are supplied to many folk in the village in spite of a new Superstore ten miles away which has taken many customers. The building trade is represented by one builder employing several workmen and is currently erecting houses in Stanhoe and other nearby places. The Crown Public House is open for drinking only. At 'Petergate Carriages' a carpenter now specialises in the building and repair of carriages.
